news.title: RMC's tax crackdown exposes widespread property fraud in Ranchi
news.para: Ranchi Municipal Corporation's revenue drive uncovered significant under-reporting of property details, with hospitals and businesses paying taxes on much smaller areas than actually used.  Irregularities included incorrect usage categories and undeclared basements.  The RMC is now correcting records and demanding dues, warning of strict penalties for non-compliance.

news.title: Plan in motion to develop areas within 500 meters of Nagpur metro corridors
news.para: MahaMetro is implementing Land Use Action Plans to transform Nagpur's Metro corridors into high-density, multimodal growth zones. Areas near stations will see increased development density and mixed-use spaces, fostering integrated urban nodes. This initiative aims to create vibrant social ecosystems and enhance livability to attract talent and businesses.

news.title: Bhubaneswar development body approves building plan of structure meant for demolition, sparks uproar
news.para: Bhubaneswar Development Authority allegedly approved a five-storey building plan despite a demolition order from the housing department. This structure was built without approvals and declared illegal by ORERA, which ordered compensation to buyers. Landowners are protesting the recent sanction, citing disregard for existing orders and lack of hearing.Promoter Built 5-Storey Structure Despite Stop-Work Notice

news.title: Stamp duty collections in Mumbai hit record high in January on larger home deals
news.para: Mumbai's property market achieved record stamp duty collections in January. Higher value property sales fueled revenue despite fewer registrations. This indicates strong buyer confidence and a shift towards premium homes. Suburban areas remain the primary hubs for property activity. The market shows resilience with sustained end-user demand.

news.title: Noida: Builder owes ₹1.8 crore, buyers at Shivalik Homes wait a decade for registry
news.para: More than 350 buyers in Surajpur, Greater Noida, face a decade-long wait for property registries. Developer Cosmos Infraestate owes Rs 1.8 crore in lease rent to UPSIDA. This has halted registries and led to punitive actions like sealing unsold flats. Residents face financial and legal hurdles. The developer claims to be resolving the issue with UPSIDA.

news.title: Reliance MET City to develop an integrated mixed-use development in Haryana
news.para: Reliance MET City has launched Metropolis, a new integrated mixed-use development. This project spans 100 acres in Daryapur, Jhajjar district, Haryana. It is part of a larger 140-acre master plan. The development includes residential and industrial plots.

news.title: About 90 hotels in Lucknow  don’t have fire safety NOC: Fire department
news.para: Nearly 90 hotels in Lucknow are operating without mandatory fire safety no-objection certificates (NOCs). Following a recent hotel fire, the fire department is set to begin enforcement action, with compliance checks starting Monday. Hotels failing to meet safety norms face potential sealing, fines, or closure.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government to develop houses for 177 Velampeta slum families
news.para: Andhra Pradesh government will develop houses for 177 families in Visakhapatnam's Velampeta slum. The decision follows a visit by Minister P Narayana, who observed the residents' hardships. The meeting also covered VMRDA master plan development, including fast-tracking seven roads and a tourism circuit.

news.title: Odisha starts identifying vacant government buildings to convert them into affordable rental housing
news.para: Odisha is transforming unused government buildings into affordable rental homes. This initiative aims to provide housing for urban poor and working people. The project will utilize public-private partnerships or public agencies.

news.title: Manesar civic body set to crack the whip on PGs operating from flats
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Manesar is launching a crackdown on residential properties operating as paying guest accommodations and commercial establishments without proper tax registration. Property owners must self-declare their property's actual use to avoid penalties, including retrospective tax reassessment and service disconnections. This move aims to curb revenue loss caused by tax evasion on commercial activities in residential zones.

news.title: At 88.4%, Mysuru civic body achieves record property tax collection in 2025
news.para: Mysuru City Corporation has set a new record by collecting 88.4% of its property tax by December 2025. This achievement surpasses previous years' collections. New strategies, including public disclosure of major defaulters, significantly boosted compliance. Other initiatives like involving self-help groups and SMS alerts also contributed. The corporation aims for 100% collection by March 2026.

news.title: Builders in Telangana seek farmhouse plotting nod in conservation zones
news.para: Realtors in Telangana are urging the state government to permit farmhouse plotting in conservation zones with specific size and construction limits. This proposal aims to curb unregulated growth, bring order to grey areas, and generate revenue. The government is considering these suggestions for unified building rules.

news.title: Hyderabad: Cheating case filed against White Waters Constructions for ₹270 crore fraud
news.para: Cyberabad police have filed a cheating case against White Waters Constructions and its directors. A woman alleged the company collected ₹270 crore from hundreds of flat buyers and failed to meet project deadlines. Buyers formed an association after delays. The investigation is ongoing, with no arrests made yet. Many buyers have their money stuck.

news.title: Crackdown on illegal colonies: Glada recovers ₹25-crore dues in Ludhiana
news.para: Greater Ludhiana Area Development Authority (Glada) has intensified its regulatory oversight of the real estate sector, issuing 33 new licenses and 15 promoter registrations in the past six months. The authority also recovered ₹25 crore in outstanding dues from defaulting colonizers, while warning the public against investing in illegal colonies.

news.title: FIRs to be filed in Manesar against violators for waste dumping, defunct STPs
news.para: Manesar civic body will now register FIRs against societies with closed sewage treatment plants and entities illegally dumping waste or discharging untreated water. Commissioner Pradeep Singh ordered immediate action during inspections, emphasizing a zero-tolerance approach to pollution and public health risks. Joint drives will also target traffic and encroachment issues in industrial areas.

news.title: Navi Mumbai: Lack of clarity on land acquisition leaves development projects in limbo
news.para: Building projects in Navi Mumbai's village areas are stalled due to a land acquisition clarity dispute between PCMC and Cidco. PCMC requires Cidco's NOC for building plan approvals, but Cidco claims it cannot issue NOCs for private land development. This impasse prevents developers from proceeding with their projects.

news.title: AAI flags unauthorised construction near Dehradun airport, warns of air safety risks
news.para: Dehradun's Jolly Grant Airport has flagged unauthorized construction near its premises, warning of significant air safety risks. The Airports Authority of India stated that prior clearance is mandatory for any construction in surrounding areas. Recent inspections revealed numerous buildings erected without the required No Objection Certificate, endangering aircraft operations and passenger safety.

news.title: Gurugram: Director of 32nd Milestone arrested for selling single property to multiple people
news.para: Gurugram police have arrested Dhruv Dutt Sharma, director of 32nd Milestone, for allegedly defrauding over 25 people of approximately Rs 500 crore. Sharma is accused of selling a single building floor to multiple buyers and then leasing it back to another firm. He has been taken on six days of police remand for further investigation.
